children.subject: <md>I currently expect the enrollment policies in Spring 2023 to be the same as Fall 2022 -- see @16779_f72.  I think there might be some misunderstandings: I encourage you to review https://cs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy-old for information on enrollment.</md>

Not sure if this is what you meant, but this article is referring to the original plan to limit CS 70 to only students who are in EECS or CS-intended L&S. (This would have excluded non-CS-intended L&S students.) That policy was never implemented, and the current policy is the one linked in @16779.

(Not the anon poet) Thanks for the clarification! Yet I recently heard of some extremely confusing information in this link from the CogSci piazza:
https://www.dailycal.org/2022/04/21/shouldnt-be-restricted-uc-berkeley-cs-70-enrollment-restrictions-rescinded/
Since the updated files are not including any similar items, should I consider this report a rumor or something that could only happen in the very distant future?

history.content: Hi, I am a freshman now. Am I wondering whether I can take CS70 in spring 2023 without any department restriction？ I was not admitted by EECS or CS major. When they were accepted by EECS or CS major, I heard that the student could take CS70. Thanks
history.subject: CS70 enrollment Question
